title: Stacey Solomon beams with happiness on holiday with her kids
text:
Stacey Solomon shared these beautiful pictures from her holiday to the Maldives (Picture: Stacey Solomon)

Stacey Solomon looked the picture of happiness as she shared photos from her holiday to the Maldives with her sons, as they waited for Joe Swash to fly in and join them.

Stacey shared photos of her relaxing on the beach in a white bikini with her boys, telling fans: ‘Beach babies. I’m determined to get a picture of all of us while we are here but for now it’s just me, Rexy and Leighton’s butt.

‘The boys are having far too much fun for pictures. Feeling so lucky to spend precious time in, what I can only describe as paradise, with them making memories. Hurry up and get here Joe Joe we miss you.’

Fans were quick to praise Stacey for posting the unedited photos on her Instagram, as she rocked her natural post-baby body five months after giving birth to baby Rex.

Her followers posted: ‘Amazing, you look beautiful and so real, my little boy is nearly 4 months old so I love watching the journey you and Rex have’.

Others added: ‘You look amazing, enjoy your holiday with your beautiful boys’ and ‘you seriously are an amazing example to young mums or any mums for that matter! Beautiful girl with a beautiful life.’

Stacey, 30, has always been honest with her fans about the realities and occasional struggles of motherhood, rather than just posting the ‘perfect’ photos on Instagram.

Stacey is waiting for Joe Swash to fly out to join them (Picture: @staceysolomon)

She recently shared a heartfelt post about feeling like a ‘failure’ for not being able to breastfeed Rex for very long.

Stacey wrote: ‘Lots of people have been asking me if I’m still breast feeding. It’s taken me a bit of time to feel okay about saying no.

‘I stopped a couple of months ago & I really struggled to come to terms with it & actually say it out loud. Breastfeeding never happened for me the way that I imagined.

Fans love seeing Stacey’s honest social media posts (Picture: @staceysolomon)

‘I did my best to try & master it, but it wasn’t to be. On day 5 we ended up back in hospital because of weight loss & I ended up pumping in between feeds to make sure he put it back on so we could be discharged, then I continued this at home until he reached his birthweight.’

She added: ‘By the time I did two full days back at work without him on the boob or pumping my milk dried up & before I knew it my breastfeeding journey was over. I felt sad for quite some time, every time he rooted my gut ached.

‘I felt like I’d failed & that I’d lost the chance to have that special time & bond with Rex. I felt like everyone else was going to feed him & I’d lose my baby.’

She explained that ultimately she wanted to do what was best for her baby to help him gain weight and bottle feeding also gives other members of the family a chance to get involved with feeding time.
